physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The oropharynx appeared normal, with no ulcers; the heart sounds were regular, and the lung sounds were clear. The remainder of the examination was normal.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The pulse decreased from 88 bpm to 87 bpm, and blood pressure decreased from 110/80 mm Hg to 110/78 mm Hg.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: The patient was described as appearing well. Breath sounds were normal in both lungs, and no clubbing or cyanosis of the hands or feet was noted.
